intro: Corydalis curviflora subsp. curviflora, commonly known as the curling corydalis, is a flowering plant native to regions of East Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and creeping.
